docs.lead_paragraph: The technique, in which a gene is injected into the heart to reprogram cells, may one day be an alternative to electronic pacemakers, researchers say.

headline.main: Gene Therapy Is Used to Adjust Pigs’ Heartbeat
headline.print_headline: Work Regulating Heart of Pig May Aid Humans

docs.abstract: Researchers at Cedars-Sinai Heart Institute report that by injecting gene into tiny section of pigs' hearts they were able to temporary reprogram ordinary heart cells into rhythm-generating cells; achievement may eventually lead to alternative to electronic pacemakers in some humans.
docs.snippet: The technique, in which a gene is injected into the heart to reprogram cells, may one day be an alternative to electronic pacemakers, researchers say.

docs.lead_paragraph: Experts disagree about using such a high and specific estimate for the level of protection, even as they celebrate the drug’s promise.

headline.main: Is Truvada, the Pill to Prevent H.I.V., 99 Percent Effective? Don’t Be So Sure

docs.snippet: Experts disagree about using such a high and specific estimate for the level of protection, even as they celebrate the drug’s promise.

docs.lead_paragraph: Nutrition facts labels on food packages list ingredients and nutrient levels, but they don't tell consumers outright if a food is good for them.

headline.main: Health Officials: Food Label Changes Not Enough
headline.print_headline: Health Officials: Food Label Changes Not Enough

docs.snippet: Nutrition facts labels on food packages list ingredients and nutrient levels, but they don't tell consumers outright if a food is good for them.

docs.lead_paragraph: Federal officials, amid the worst U.S. biosafety crisis in years, have dismissed 11 eminent scientists from a 23-member panel that advises the government on how and whether research on dangerous pathogens should be conducted.

headline.main: U.S. Officials Purge Biosafety Board in Midst of Anthrax Crisis
headline.print_headline: U.S. Officials Purge Biosafety Board in Midst of Anthrax Crisis

docs.snippet: Federal officials, amid the worst U.S. biosafety crisis in years, have dismissed 11 eminent scientists from a 23-member panel that advises the government on how and whether research on dangerous pathogens should be conducted.
